intro: Marathrum haenkeanum, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or violet in color. It produces small, round berries that are edible when ripe but contain toxic compounds when unripe. This plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
